titleInfo.title: Sunshine, Feiner, and Ginsberg Families Composite

physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 8 x 10 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: On envelope: ''#78 Sunshine, Feiner and Ginsberg Families Immigrants''. On note inside envelope: ''#78 Immigrants: Mr. and Mrs. Sunshine Donor: Mrs. Albert Brennan Mr. and Mrs. Jacob Feiner Donor: Mr. Louis Cook Mr. and MRs. Jacob Sarnoff Ginsberg. He made 6 crossings to Russia and died in Brest-Letovsk, 1914 Donor: Mrs. Ira Beck''.

mods.abstract: Three formal poses of the heads of the Sunshine, Feiner, and Ginsberg families: Mr. and Mrs. Sunshine (left, standing), Mr.and Mrs. Jacob Feiner (center, seated and wearing hats), Mr. and Mrs. Jacob Sarnoff Ginsberg (right, she is standing, he is seated). Composite was made sometime in the 1970s, but the original images date to the early 20th century.
mods.note: Appears in ''Images of America: Jewish Denver 1859-1940,'' by Dr. Jeanne Abrams, on page 94.
Donated by Mrs. Albert Brenman, Mr. Louis cook and Mrs. Ira Beck.

titleInfo.title: Beck Archives Photograph Collection, Families and Groups
